title: Fake Zee News Graphic Claims Total Lockdown From June 15
subtitle: Zee News also dismissed the viral graphic stating that it was fake and photoshopped.
author: www.boomlive.in
vclaim:
An image purporting to be a graphic by Zee News claiming India's Home Ministry has signalled the country could be heading toward a complete lockdown from June 15, 2020, is fake and poorly photoshopped.

The news graphic is viral in the backdrop of the ongoing Coronavirus led lockdown which was extended till June 30, 2020. However, relaxations have been granted to non-containment areas, which have been allowed to re-open in three phases. 



The breaking news ticker reads, "After June 15, 2020, a complete lockdown could be imposed again hinted the Home Ministry, Train and air travel will be stopped. After the increase of COVID-19 cases, a decision was taken."



BOOM received the viral graphic on its WhatsApp helpline number (7700906111) inquiring about it.

Click here to view an archive.

We ran a search on Google with the keywords, 'Zee News', 'June 15', and 'lockdown', and did not find any news reports on a complete lockdown to be implemented by the government nor did we find any Zee News report on this.

We found a statement put out by Zee News stating that the viral graphic had not been broadcasted by the channel and that it was photoshopped. The channel put out an article on Facebook which called the viral graphic fake.

"Zee News has not shown any such news on its channel nor has run any such breaking news. This photo of the TV screen being spread in the name of Zee News is completely fake and photoshopped," stated the channel in the article.

Additionally, we compared the 'breaking news' template used by Zee News and found that the viral graphic whose background is maroon does not match the red background and white text used by the channel.
